1   package org.lindbergframework.persistence.beans;
2   
3   import java.lang.reflect.Field;
4   import java.sql.SQLException;
5   import java.util.Collection;
6   
7   import org.apache.commons.beanutils.Converter;
8   import org.lindbergframework.beans.di.annotation.Bean;
9   import org.lindbergframework.beans.util.BeanUtil;
10  import org.lindbergframework.exception.BeanPopulateException;
11  import org.lindbergframework.persistence.sql.DataSet;
12  import org.lindbergframework.persistence.sql.RowDataTree;
13  import org.lindbergframework.persistence.sql.SqlNode;
14  import org.lindbergframework.util.ReflectionUtil;
15  
16  /**
17   * Bean populator that implements the mult level population.
18   * 
19   * The mult level population occurs setting properties values
20   * in several levels. 
21   * 
22   * E.g. 
23   * A Person bean and a Address bean.
24   * 
25   *  Person
26   *    - String name
27   *    - Address address
28   *    
29   *  Address
30   *     - String street
31   *     - int number
32   *     
33   *  This bean populator works with ({@link RowDataTree}). 
34   *  This enables to populate the Address street property inside of Person bean
35   *  like a data tree creating Adress instance and setting street property value and 
36   *  setting after the created Address instance in Person. 
37   * 
38   * @author Victor Lindberg
39   *
40   */
41  @Bean("multLevelsBeanPopulator")
42  public class MultLevelsBeanPopulator extends BeanPopulatorBase{
43  	
44  	public MultLevelsBeanPopulator(){
45  		//
46  	}
47  	
48  	/**
49  	 * Creates and Populates a bean based on {@link RowDataTree}.
50  	 * 
51  	 * @param <E> bean type.
52       * @param beanClass bean class to populate.
53       * @param rowDataTree {@link RowDataTree} that will be used to populate the bean.
54       * @return populated bean.
55       * @throws BeanPopulateException bean population failed.
56  	 */
57  	public <E> E populate(Class<E> beanClass, RowDataTree rowDataTree) throws BeanPopulateException{
58  		try {
59  			E beanInstance = beanClass.newInstance();
60  			SqlNode root = rowDataTree.getTree();
61  			populateMultLevel(beanInstance, root.getChildren());
62  			
63  			return beanInstance;
64  		} catch (InstantiationException ex) {
65  		   throw new BeanPopulateException(ex);
66  		} catch (IllegalAccessException ex) {
67  		   throw new BeanPopulateException(ex);
68  		}
69  	}
70  	
71  	/**
72  	 * {@inheritDoc}
73  	 */
74  	public <E> E populate(Class<E> beanClass, DataSet dataSet) throws BeanPopulateException {
75  		return populate(beanClass,new RowDataTree(dataSet));
76  	}
77  	
78  	/**
79  	 * {@inheritDoc}
80  	 */
81  	public <E> E populateDirectValue(Class<E> beanClass, DataSet dataSet) throws BeanPopulateException {
82  	    try {
83  	        if (dataSet.getMetaData().getColumnCount() != 1)
84  	            throw new BeanPopulateException("Could not populate direct value. Query has more than one column. Try to use the populate method.");
85  	    
86  	        Converter converter = BeanUtil.getConverter(beanClass);
87  	        if (converter == null)
88  	            throw new BeanPopulateException("Could not populate bean. Converter not found for the specified type ["+beanClass+"]. Try to use the populate method");
89          
90              Object value = dataSet.getValue(1);
91              return (E) converter.convert(beanClass, value);
92          } catch (SQLException ex) {
93              throw new BeanPopulateException(ex);
94          }
95  	}
96  	
97  	/**
98  	 * Executes recursive mult level population in bean instance based on {@link SqlNode} {@link Collection} argument.
99  	 * 
100 	 * @param <E> bean type.
101 	 * @param bean bean instance to populate.
102 	 * @param protetiesNodes {@link SqlNode} {@link Collection} containing sql result values.
103 	 * @throws BeanPopulateException error populating bean.
104 	 * @throws InstantiationException error creating some bean property.
105 	 * @throws IllegalAccessException error accessing some bean property.
106 	 * 
107 	 * @return populated bean.
108 	 */
109 	protected <E> void populateMultLevel(E bean,Collection<SqlNode> protetiesNodes) 
110 	                 throws BeanPopulateException, InstantiationException, IllegalAccessException{
111 		for (SqlNode node : protetiesNodes){ 
112            String propertyName = sqlColumnToJavaProperyPattern(node.getProperty());		   
113 		   
114 		   Field property = ReflectionUtil.getField(bean, propertyName,true);
115 		
116 		   if (propertyName == null || property == null)
117 			  continue;
118         
119 		   if (node.isLeaf())
120 			   BeanUtil.loadProperty(bean, propertyName, node.getValue());
121 		   else{//node has children
122 			     Object beanPropertyInstance = property.getType().newInstance();
123 			     populateMultLevel(beanPropertyInstance, node.getChildren());
124 			     BeanUtil.loadProperty(bean, propertyName, beanPropertyInstance);
125 		   }
126 		}
127 	}
128 	
129 }
